title: Brad Marchand reveals ‘main reason’ why his contract talks with Bruins broke down
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins "I want to play until I get kicked out of the league.
” Brad Marchand signed a six-year deal with the Panthers this offseason.
AP Photo/Lynne Sladky By Conor Ryan September 17, 2025 2 minutes to read In a perfect world, Brad Marchand would still be in Boston and holding court as the Bruins’ captain this fall.

title: 2 Framingham police officers on leave amid ‘misconduct’ investigation
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News The two officers are on paid administrative leave, the department said.
The issues “under review involve potential health and wellness concerns.
” The Framingham Police Department put two of its officers on leave amid an internal investigation into alleged “misconduct,” Chief Lester Baker announced Monday.

title: Lockdown lifted at Fall River high school after bomb, gun threat deemed a hoax
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Local News A caller reported that they were in one of the school bathrooms with a bomb and an AK-47 assault rifle, according to police.
A Fall River high school was placed into lockdown Wednesday after a reported threat which now appears to be a hoax, according to police.

Officers responded that morning to Diman Regional Vocational Technical High School after a caller reported that they were in one of the school bathrooms and had a bomb and an AK-47 assault rifle, Fall River police said on Facebook.

title: Drake Maye credits Aaron Rodgers for developing key aspect of his QB game
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots "He’s very talented throwing the football, and I think he’s got some swagger to him.
" Drake Maye is set to battle against Aaron Rodgers in Week 3.
John Tlumacki/Boston Globe By Conor Ryan September 17, 2025 3 minutes to read Drake Maye has not shied away from sharing his affinity for Steelers QB Aaron Rodgers over the years.

title: Mass. releases COVID-19 vaccine guidance day before CDC vaccine meeting
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News Children between six months and 23 months "should receive" the vaccine, while healthy children and healthy adults "may receive" the shot, according to Mass.
health officials.
FILE - Pharmacist Kenni Clark injects Robert Champion, of Lawrence, Mass.

title: ABC suspends Jimmy Kimmel’s late-night show indefinitely over his remarks about Charlie Kirk’s death
author: The Associated Press
bullets: Politics President Donald Trump celebrated ABC's move on the social media site Truth Social, writing: “Congratulations to ABC for finally having the courage to do what had to be done.
” Jimmy Kimmel poses in the press room with the award for host for a game show for "Who Wants to Be a Millionaire" during night two of the Creative Arts Emmy Awards on Sunday, Sept.
7, 2025, at the Peacock Theater in Los Angeles.

title: Search continues in Auburn for man, 58, missing since last week
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Local News Police say they have seen several false reports that the missing man has been found and are continuing the search.
Darren Cyr, 58, of Auburn, has been missing since Sept.
12, according to Auburn police.

title: David Pastrnak dealing with tendinitis and other takeaways from 1st day of Bruins training camp
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins "We as a group just said load management at this point in time is what's the best course of action.
" David Pastrnak will miss the first few days of Boston's training camp.
(AP Photo/Karl DeBlaker, File) By Conor Ryan September 17, 2025 | 6:28 PM 5 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Steelers pick up former Patriots LB Ja’Whaun Bentley ahead of trip to Foxborough
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots After signing Jabrill Peppers earlier this month, the Steelers are bringing Bentley on board.
Ja'Whaun Bentley AP Photo/Greg M.
Cooper Ja’Whaun Bentley, who spent the first seven years of his career with the Patriots, has signed with the Pittsburgh Steelers’ practice squad, according to ESPN.

title: Patriots will ‘stick to the same plan’ this week with Zak Kuhr calling plays as Terrell Williams recovers
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots Williams will be more involved this week, but the defensive play-calling set up will be the same as last week, according to Mike Vrabel.

Terrell Williams Danielle Parhizkaran/The Boston Globe FOXBOROUGH — The Patriots are sticking with inside linebackers coach Zak Kuhr as their defensive playcaller for the second-straight week as defensive coordinator Terrell Williams continues to recover from an unforeseen health issue, coach Mike Vrabel said Monday.
The home contest against Pittsburgh will be the second straight-game Williams has missed.
